flow.descriptionCdata:
60c976fe-9562-40a6-b303-0239613b14c6.6d2b647f-629e-4f72-ad76-95d6ee0201b7.description=
This operation checks whether a string matches another string, using a specific matching rule. The "toMatch" input is the string that is checked for matching the "matchTo" expression. 

Inputs\:
    matchType - The type of match to perform.
Valid values\: Exact Match, Contains, Contains Once, Does Not Contain, Match All Words, Match No Words, Regex (The values are not case sensitive)
Default value\: Exact Match
    toMatch - The string that is checked for matching.
    matchTo - The string to match against.
Example\: If "matchType" is “RegEx”, the "matchTo" input is a regular expression such as\: ^-?\d+(([\.,]\d+)?)+$. 
    ignoreCase - Specifies whether to ignore case when matching or not.
Valid values\: False, True
Default value\: False

Results\:
    returnResult - This is the primary output. It contains the string "Matches" if the "toMatch" string matches the "matchTo" string. Otherwise, it contains the string "Does Not Match".  

Responses\:
    success - The operation completed as stated in the description.
    failure - The operation completed unsuccessfully.
60c976fe-9562-40a6-b303-0239613b14c6.9e740513-b331-4648-9b08-63c085b3737d.description=
The operation runs a SSH command on the host.

Inputs\:
    host - Hostname or ip address.
    port - The port number for running the command. It overwrites the port given inside the host input (in a syntax like host\:port), if this exists.
    command - The command to execute.
    arguments - The arguments to pass to the command.
    pty - Whether to use pty.
Valid values\: true, false. 
Default value\: false.
    privateKeyFile - The absolute path to the private key file on the RAS host. The private key file must be in OpenSSH format.
    username - Username to connect as.
    password - Password of user. If using a private key file this will be used as the passphrase for the file.
    timeout - Time in milliseconds to wait for the command to complete.
Default value\: 90000 ( 90 seconds ).
    characterSet - The character encoding used for input stream encoding from the target machine. 
Valid values\: SJIS, EUC-JP, UTF-8.  
Default value\: UTF-8. 
    closeSession - If "false" the ssh session will be cached for future calls of this operation during the life of the flow. If "true" the ssh session used by this operation will be closed.
Valid values\: true, false.
Default value\: true.

Results\:
    returnResult - This is the primary output. It contains the STDERR of the command if something went wrong or STDOUT otherwise.
    STDERR - The STDERR of the command.
    STDOUT - The STDOUT of the command.
    exitStatus - Every command returns an exit status (sometimes referred to as a return status or exit code). A successful command returns a 0, while an unsuccessful one returns a non-zero value that usually can be interpreted as an error code.

Responses\:
    success - The command was executed successfully.
    failure - The command could not be executed.

Notes\:
1. If the SSH session is cached then only the connection is kept and not the context (variables) represented by SSH channel.
2. In order to use private keys with different encryption types (ex.\: aes256-cbc) needs to be updated the /java/lib/security/local_policy.jar JAR file with one that accept all security policies (ex.\: http\://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/javase/downloads/jce-7-download-432124.html). After update you must restart the Studio or Central service.

60c976fe-9562-40a6-b303-0239613b14c6.e79654bb-a501-44d6-859c-a0b71d8c3fc6.description=

60c976fe-9562-40a6-b303-0239613b14c6.e7bbcb9c-df09-40fc-8ecc-b7ca41fd1e3b.description=
 
Check to see if the value stored in a specified flow variable, denoted by key, is null.

Inputs\:
    keyName - The key to check, i.e. the name of the flow variable. 
    trimSpaces - If set on "true" then all the whitespaces will be removed from the value stored. 
Valid values\: true, false
Default value\: false

Returns\: 
    The value in the specified key, i.e. flow variable with all whitespaces removed.

Responses\:
    isNull - If the key is a null pointer, i.e. the flow variable doesn't have an assigned value.
    notNull - If some value is stored in the key, i.e the flow variable has a value assigned. 

Notes\: 
    1. If the "trimSpaces" input is set on "true" and the value from "keyName" contains only whitespaces then the response will be "isNull". 
    2. If the "trimSpaces" input is set on "false" and the value from "keyName" contains only whitespaces then the response will be "notNull". 
    3. If any other value than "true" or "false" is passed on "trimSpaces" input then the default value (false) will be used.
flow.name: Agregar a archivo hosts

step.name: Quitar linea no coincidente en hosts
